quizzes.title: History Quiz: Route and Atlantic
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, lakes, panther. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: These rivers empty into the Baltic Sea basin. Which discharges the greatest amount of water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neva

questions.question: What was Huey P. Newton charged with on October 28th, 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murder

questions.question: Which of these pairs of lakes lie entirely within Italy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Como and Garda

questions.question: Which is the first of the Black Panther Partys 10 point program?

options.text: We Want Freedom. We Want Power To Determine The Destiny Of Our Black Community
We Want Decent Housing Fit For The Shelter Of Human Beings
We Want An Immediate End To Police Brutality And Murder Of Black People
We Want All Black Men To Be Exempt From Military Service

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We Want Freedom. We Want Power To Determine The Destiny Of Our Black Community

questions.question: In which country do you find Masuria, sometimes called the Land of a Thousand Lakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: The Canal des Deux Mers (i.e. the Two Seas Canal) is the name of a route that allows shipping to pass across France from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean. Which river forms a significant part of the route, by linking the Atlantic with the Canal du Midi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Garonne

questions.question: What was the Black Panthers response when California passed the Mulford Act, a bill designed to ban the display of loaded weapons in 1967.

options.text: They changed their name and ceased to function
They held an armed march in Sacramento
They held a sit-in at the Capital building

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They held an armed march in Sacramento

questions.question: Who are the founding members of the Black Panther Party for Self Defense?

options.text: Bobby Seale and Huey P. Newton
Heuy P. Newton and Che Guevera

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby Seale and Huey P. Newton

questions.question: The name of Chicago comes from the Miami-Illinois expression shikaakwa. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild onion

questions.question: The Black Panther Party started free breakfast programs for children, free clinics for the greater Oakland community, and brought Black history to American Schools.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who did the Black Panther Party draft as Field Marshall of the East Coast in June of 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stokely Carmichael

questions.question: What single act announced the Black Panther Partys presence to the people of Oakland in February of 1967?

options.text: They had two members elected to congress
They followed the police with shotguns and law books
They opened offices in every major city in America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They followed the police with shotguns and law books

questions.question: Huey P. Newton was killed by his drug dealer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Bobby Seale was killed in a police shootout on May 6th, 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who were the first Black Panther Members to run for political office?

options.text: Huey P. Newton and David Hilliard
Huey P. Newton and Bobby Seale

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elaine Brown and Bobby Seale

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Saudi Arabia and Chicago
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these movies was set in Chicago, Illinois, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Best Friends Wedding

questions.question: The national anthem of Saudi Arabia is called Aash Al Maleek. What does this mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long live the King

questions.question: Which of these entertainers was born in the city of Chicago, Illinois, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robin Williams

questions.question: Which of these countries does not share a border with Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iran

questions.question: What is the difference between the popular Chicago-style pizza and the traditional Italian pizza?

options.text: The Chicago-style pizza is baked in a square dish.
The Chicago-style pizza is topped only with large amounts of bacon.
The Chicago-style pizza is much thicker.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chicago-style pizza is much thicker.

questions.question: What type of government does Saudi Arabia have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Absolute monarchy

questions.question: What plant is depicted on the coat of arms of Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Palm tree

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Riyadh

questions.question: Which of these statements is wrong about the city of Chicago, Illinois, USA?

options.text: In the 19th century, it was the second most populous U.S. city.
Chicago is the fifth-largest city in the United States.
Chicago is the second-largest city in the U.S. state of Illinois.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What actor starred in Rob Marshalls 2002 musical movie Chicago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Gere

questions.question: In what month is the famous Chicago International Film Festival held annually?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: October

questions.question: What is the traditional color of the agal, the accessory worn by Arabs in order to keep the traditional headdress called Keffiyeh in place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: Which of these nicknames was given to the city of Chicago, Illinois, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hog Butcher for the World

questions.question: What object is carried during the traditional Saudi Arabian dance called Ardha?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swords

questions.question: What is depicted on the national flag of Saudi Arabia?

options.text: A crescent moon and a star

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sword

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Nebraska and Cambodia
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, soul. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the queen who tells the king the stories in the Arabian collection of fairy tales One Thousand and One Nights?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scheherazade

questions.question: The consumption of which of the following is forbidden by Islamic dietary laws in Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the state mammal of the U.S. state of Nebraska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deer

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city of the U.S. state of Nebraska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lincoln

questions.question: How many distinct seasons are there in Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two

questions.question: What is the state beverage of the U.S. state of Nebraska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milk

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city in the Kingdom of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phnom Penh

questions.question: Which of these is a nickname given to the U.S. state of Nebraska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beef State

questions.question: What part of the body is considered to contain the soul according to Cambodian beliefs and tradition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Head

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of the Kingdom of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Royal Kingdom

questions.question: What serious ecological problem threatens the wildlife of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the official language spoken by the population of the Kingdom of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Khmer

questions.question: The name of the U.S. state of Nebraska is believed to have originated from a phrase meaning which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flat water

questions.question: What is the predominant religion among the population of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddhism

questions.question: Which of these great Hollywood actors was born in the U.S. state of Nebraska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Geisha and Maiko
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, outfit, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present on the national flag of the Kingdom of Cambodia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: What part of her clothing does a maiko, or an apprentice gaisha, change when she becomes a geisha in a ceremony called erikae?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Collar

questions.question: Why were geisha trained to sleep with their necks on small supports called takamakura instead of on pillows?

options.text: Not to get wrinkles on their skin
To learn to keep balance even in their sleep

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To keep their hairstyle perfect

questions.question: It was traditional in the past for established geisha to have a danna. What does a danna mean?

options.text: A special and very expensive Japanese fan
A beautiful bird in a cage
A large chest to store her kimonos ans makeup

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A patron

questions.question: What is the real name of Sayuki, the first Caucasian geisha in history, who was born in  Melbourne, Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiona Graham

questions.question: What is the name of the elegant, high-culture world that geisha are a part of in Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The flower and willow world

questions.question: What type of meat is used for the preparation of the traditional Cambodian dish Amok trey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fish

questions.question: What color do maiko, or apprentice geisha, sometimes paint their teeth in their last stage of training?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: The Latin motto of the US state of Kansas is Ad astra per aspera. What does this mean in English?

options.text: To the stars as we dream

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To the stars through difficulties

questions.question: After what period of work does a maiko, or an apprentice geisha, change her heavy makeup with a more natural one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three years

questions.question: Unpainted area with what shape do geisha traditionally leave on their nape when applying their makeup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W-shaped

questions.question: What is the mane of the flat-soled sandals that geisha wear outdoors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zori

questions.question: What is the literal translation of the Japanese word geisha?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Performing artist

questions.question: What type of the traditional Cambodian outfit is the krama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarf

questions.question: What was the US state of Kansas named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A river

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Kansas and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cape, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is the nickname of the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: This explorer sailed around the Cape of Good Hope into the Indian Ocean and explored Mozambique in 1498. He was the first European to establish a trade route around the southern tip of Africa all the way to India.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vasco da Gama

questions.question: Which of these is a baseball team from Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kansas City T-Bones

questions.question: If you wanted to go snorkeling or scuba diving off the coast of Mozambique, you might want to explore which of the following popular diving spots?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bazaruto Archipelago

questions.question: What is the state mammal of the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bison

questions.question: According to 2007 estimates 99.66% of the population of Mozambique is of what ethnic group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bantu

questions.question: Mozambique was colonized in 1505 by which European country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portugal

questions.question: Which of these fictional characters is from the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dorothy Gale

questions.question: What is the color of the official state flag of Kansas, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue

questions.question: What natural disaster is common for the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tornado

questions.question: What is the capital city of Mozambique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maputo

questions.question: What is the official state flower and symbol of the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunflower

questions.question: What are the 2 most popular religions in Mozambique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Muslim and Catholic

questions.question: What is the name of the capital city of the US state of Kansas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Topeka

questions.question: What is the most widely spoken language in Mozambique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portuguese

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Georgia and State
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, atlanta, uganda. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these movies is set in the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these American Presidents was born in Plains, Georgia, USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: What is the official motto of the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wisdom, Justice, Moderation

questions.question: What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peach State

questions.question: What is the state flower of the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherokee Rose

questions.question: What are the colors of the official state flag of the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red, white, blue

questions.question: According to the World Health Organization, the top 3 causes of death in the USA are heart disease, stroke, and lung cancer. What are the top 3 causes of death in Mozambique?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: HIV/AIDS, Malaria, Diarrhea

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta

questions.question: What is the capital of Uganda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kampala

questions.question: According to the World Health Organization, in 2007 0.6% of American adults had HIV. What percentage of the population of Mozambique had HIV?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: Which of these is one of the major agricultural outputs of the U.S. state of Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poultry breeding

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of CAR (Central African Republic)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bangui

questions.question: According to the World Health Organization, life expectancy in the United States is 67 years for males, 71 years for females. What is the life expectancy in Mozambique according to 2007 estimates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 41 male, 40 female

questions.question: In what sport do the Atlanta Hawks team from Georgia, USA compete?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basketball

questions.question: To what climatic phenomenon is the U.S. state of Georgia vulnerable?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these
